docs.lead_paragraph: The health care reform bill currently being debated in the Senate contains a provision known as the Bo-Tax - so called because it would levy a 5 percent tax on cosmetic surgery procedures. The idea is to tax those who indulge in medically unnecessary procedures in order to pay for medical necessities for everyone else.
docs.abstract: When feminists are fighting a tax on cosmetic surgery, you know the movement has reached a new phase.
docs.snippet: When feminists are fighting a tax on cosmetic surgery, you know the movement has reached a new phase.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the biggest questions looming over the Democrats' health care legislation is whether the bill would be aggressive enough in trying to slow the seemingly out-of-control medical costs for both the federal government and average Americans.

headline.main: Freshmen Democrats Prepare Amendment on Cost Containment

docs.abstract: A new independent commission would be directed to look at the health care system over all and to make recommendations for voluntary steps to lower costs.
docs.snippet: A new independent commission would be directed to look at the health care system over all and to make recommendations for voluntary steps to lower costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama's speech on Afghanistan at West Point continues to command a lot of ink on the blogs (or is that bytes?), as does the health care bill, like here and here. Also big are discussions on climate change, as the summit at Copenhagen nears.
docs.abstract: From the president's jobs summit to the confirmation hearings for Ben Bernanke, economic issues predominate on the Web.
docs.snippet: From the president's jobs summit to the confirmation hearings for Ben Bernanke, economic issues predominate on the Web.

docs.lead_paragraph: Even though the American Medical Association offered some qualified support to the Senate health care bill this week, many other medical groups were unqualified in their opposition.

headline.main: Many Doctors' Groups Oppose Senate Bill

docs.abstract: The Senate health care bill has some qualified support from the American Medical Association, but many doctors' groups are against it.
docs.snippet: The Senate health care bill has some qualified support from the American Medical Association, but many doctors' groups are against it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Breaking a three-day stalemate, the Senate approved an amendment to its health care legislation that would require insurance companies to offer free mammograms and other preventive services to women.
docs.abstract: The Senate held the first vote on amending its health care legislation, agreeing to require insurance companies to provide free mammograms and other preventive services for women.
docs.snippet: The Senate held the first vote on amending its health care legislation, agreeing to require insurance companies to provide free mammograms and other preventive services for women.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate on Wednesday night agreed to bar the federal government from relying on the findings of an independent panel of health experts that recently recommended women should begin having routine mammograms at age 50 rather than at age 40.

headline.main: Senate Blocks Use of New Mammogram Guidelines

docs.abstract: Republican senators seek to ban the federal government from relying on the findings of an independent panel of health experts that recently recommended women not begin routine mammograms until age 50.
docs.snippet: Republican senators seek to ban the federal government from relying on the findings of an independent panel of health experts that recently recommended women not begin routine mammograms until age 50.

docs.lead_paragraph: Given the incredibly depressing nature of all the big news stories of the week, it’s understandable that people would rather focus on the marital problems of Tiger Woods.
docs.snippet: Given the incredibly depressing nature of all the big news stories of the week, it’s understandable that people would rather focus on the marital problems of Tiger Woods.

docs.lead_paragraph: One Harvard official said the suspension was “really a function of the endowment going down drastically.”

headline.main: Harvard Law School Suspends Program Giving Students Free Tuition
headline.print_headline: Harvard Law School Suspends Program Giving Students Free Tuition

docs.snippet: One Harvard official said the suspension was “really a function of the endowment going down drastically.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Senate Democrats and Republicans said they had broken an impasse over the seemingly simple question of how and when to vote on the first amendments to a sweeping health care bill.

headline.main: Senate Breaks Health Stalemate; First Votes Today
headline.print_headline: Senate Breaks Health Stalemate; First Votes Today

docs.snippet: Senate Democrats and Republicans said they had broken an impasse over the seemingly simple question of how and when to vote on the first amendments to a sweeping health care bill.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

docs.lead_paragraph: Opinions on the Afghan war remained diverse, but the president persuaded some people on both sides of the political aisle.

headline.main: Afghanistan Speech by Obama Wins Over Some Skeptics
headline.sub: But Public Opinion on Topic Remains Wildly Diverse ;
headline.print_headline: Obama’s War Speech Wins Over Some Skeptics

docs.snippet: Opinions on the Afghan war remained diverse, but the president persuaded some people on both sides of the political aisle.
